remarks: The size of a graph is the number of the edges of the graph. (Contributed by AV, 4-Jan-2020.)  (Revised by AV, 15-Jan-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
usgsizedgALT2.e $e |- E = ( Edges ` G ) $.
usgsizedgALT2.s $e |- S = ( # ` ( 2nd ` G ) ) $.
usgsizedgALT2 $p |- ( G e. USGrph -> S = ( # ` E ) ) $.
